byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan, and Matthew Rosenberg and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.
byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and MUJIB MASHAL

abstract: Afghan and Taliban officials meet for first time, in significant step toward possibility of opening formal peace negotiations.
lead_paragraph: The Taliban has rejected face-to-face talks for years, and officials hope Tuesday’s meeting in Pakistan is a step toward peace negotiations.

headline.main: Afghan Officials and Taliban Meet in Possible Step Toward Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Afghan Officials and Taliban Meet in Possible Step Toward Peace Talks

snippet: The Taliban has rejected face-to-face talks for years, and officials hope Tuesday’s meeting in Pakistan is a step toward peace negotiations.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
